content: Which 19th-century author penned the classic novels "Wuthering Heights" and "Jane Eyre," along with their siblings?

I believe the author you're referring to is Charlotte Brontë. She wrote "Jane Eyre," and her sisters, Emily and Anne Brontë, also published novels under pseudonyms. Emily Brontë authored "Wuthering Heights," while Anne Brontë wrote "Agnes Grey" and "The Tenant of Wildfell Hall." The Brontë sisters were indeed a remarkable literary family from the 19th century.
